title: Where are all the large casual clans?
body:
_(Excuse me if this should be posted somewhere else)_

I am just a measly bronze support looking for a group of friendly people to queue up with so I can avoid the ultra trolls and salty children. There are thousands of teams looking to fill specific competitive roles but I don't have the time for scheduled practices, nor the desire to jump on TS every time I want to play a game.

LoL is one of the largest online games on the market yet there seems to be a lack of large supportive groups. I'm thinking along the lines of large 100+ player clans, not small groups of friends. 

So, if anyone knows of a good group of people, I'd love to join it.

_About me:
Grown man. 23y/o
I play a few games per day, random times. 
I play for fun, not to win. Although winning is fun too.
Sometimes a little trollish... {{champion:61}} & {{champion:432}}  support..._

Update: **Send me an invite in game to join a group. I am still looking for a larger group to join so when I/we find one, we will merge. **

replies.body: Just throw me, Lil Dik, a friend invite and I'll send everyone a clan request. No requirements but if anyone is found to be too immature or too trollish you will be removed.
You can add me I am down

There are a few, I've been invited to a couple in my time on League, they just seem to have a tendency to die when a couple core members lose interest.  I'm part of a pretty large (~60 or so members, ~30 active on a day-to-day basis) group that uses Discord to communicate and host the whole group, but I'd have to check with the current leader to see what the policies are on people joining since there've been a lot of changes recently with the old leader leaving the group.
